name: Four Points by Sheraton Levis Convention Centre

reviews.text: I booked this hotel because I was running the SSQ Marathon Weekend in the area and I really did not want to stay in Old Quebec City because most hotels there are older and small, this one was newer, modern, plenty of free parking and a quick car ride over to Old Quebec City. It was also the race bib pickup for one race, as well as the start of the marathon and a short ride away to the start of the hallf marathon.
reviews.title: Loved Our Stay

reviews.text: The room was clean and spacious. The washroom was a good size and I loved the little table area off to the side of the sink. I did find the sink too narrow though. It would be great if the room had a mini fridge to store fruit and cold drinks though but not something that would deter me from booking this hotel again.
reviews.title: Must stay

reviews.text: The front staff was friendly and spoke English perfectly.
reviews.title: Currently very good.... but I see some dark clouds on the horizon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definately recommend this hotel but it is in more of a commercial area, your view from the room is very uneventful!
reviews.title: 1st Time Visitor - Had Two Excellent Stays in August

reviews.text: Our group of two couples stayed there for one night on our way back from PEI to Toronto. The hotel is very well deco leaving me a posh impression and a very peaceful feeling. The receptionist was very efficient and articulate in sorting out room details and our queries about going to the old quebec city. The hotel also provided free shuttle services to and fro ferry services to the old Quebec city. I highly recommend taking this shuttle services to board the ferry for the old Quebec city. This will save you all the headache of driving into the city and packing your car. Stroll around the old city was a great experience. The hotel room was spacious, well thought out furnished, perfectly house kept and excellently soundproofed. Despite of no breakfast, the room rate for the quality of services rendered was value for money.
reviews.title: New and clean

reviews.text: Went here for jsut one night and wish I coulda stayed longer. You walk in and right off the start you get a feeling this hotel is different. More modern layout. Love the neon lighting,
reviews.title: Great on a Budget

reviews.text: Staff was very friendly and polite.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Levis, incredible restaurant!

reviews.text: Room itself was amazing. 2 very comfy queen size beds (which you just sank into) with 5 pillows on each. Very Spacious. Had a computer desk, Chair, extra sitting chair. flat screen tv, and a great view. The room itself looked as if we were the first ones to stay in it!!
reviews.title: Great hotel in Levis

reviews.text: Need I say outdoor jacuzzi!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second stay at the Four Points Levis. We stayed at this property on our way back to Ottawa from Nova Scotia. Levis is ideally located just off the Trans Canada just before Quebec City, a good point to stop at after driving all day.
reviews.title: Excellent stop near the highway, always a great value

reviews.text: The property is brand new, just a year old, if memory serves and the newness shows. Everything is new, shiny and well looked after. The check in process was smooth and courteous. We paid for our room with the "cash and points" option that Starwood offers. As a result, we could not get access to a room with a king sized bed due to restrictions on the rate plan, but it really wasn't a big deal.
reviews.title: Excellant hotel and price

reviews.text: The rooms are clean and large with the linens and beds that you would come to expect at any Four Points. The decor is funky and modern, with nice fixtures in the bathroom that follow that "modern" aesthetic. The rooms have flat screen television and a large desk. There are no fridges in the rooms with two queen beds, but if you opt for the larger Jacuzzi suite, a room class we have also stayed in, a fridge is included. The climate control in the room works very well and we were able to have a cool, comfortable sleep.
reviews.title: Excellent value!

reviews.text: There is a very funky restaurant in the hotel complex called "Cosmos". It has a very diverse menu, really interesting decor, nightclub-ish music and bilingual staff. The food is moderate fare for a fair price. There is a pool and hot tub outdoors, I believe, but we did not use either.
reviews.title: Nice hotel across the river from Quebec City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we enjoyed our second stay at the Four Points Sheraton Levis and would recommend it to any weary traveller looking for a comfortable, modern property for a fair price.
reviews.title: Fantastic Room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night on our way back to Ontario from the Maritimes. We were quite surprised at how nice this hotel was. The front staff were excellent in explaining all their amenities and the shuttle one could take to visit Quebec City...The room and bathroom was spacious, and modern and very clean.. The bed was very comfortable.Dinner at the adjoining restaurant, Cosmos. It was a very busy Friday night but we were served promptly and courteously. Would return to stay here and take the ferry over to Quebec City... rather than fight to find parking in the old town.. Look forward to staying there again.
reviews.title: Great little gem

reviews.text: that hotel sucks it is boring levis is boring and they say there a pool and its a hot tub so it sucks!!!!! bad experience rooms where dirty i will always remember this hotel for the bad reasons the only reason i went there was for family reason but now i dont need to go anymore so il never go back
reviews.title: worst hotel ever

reviews.text: Although there are superior locations for visitors looking to spend most of their time in Quebec City, it is a beautiful, well-appointed hotel in the outskirts of Levis. It would be difficult to find a nicer room in the area for the price and is worth the quick drive into the city (or to the ferry in Levis).
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel
Great Hotel!
reviews.text: We were very impressed with this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. As we were interested in taking the ferry over to Quebec City, the shuttle bus to the ferry terminal was particularly appreciated. The room was very clean and had excellent beds. The restaurant, Cosmos, was worth going into as their breakfast was great. We would definitely stay at this hotel in the future

We needed a place for one night stay. We first wanted to go to Quebec city but since the Pink Floyd show was that same night, the was no way we could find a room. Then, I called to FP Lévis and they just had a cancelation. Youpi, I booked the room and so we left.
reviews.title: Nice quick stay

reviews.text: I have stayed in this hotel with my family, we have spent in this hotel one night. The room was modern and clean. The hotel located in the suburb, the only way to get to Quebec city is the ferry, but to keep your car in the ferry park is $10! The staff in the reception desk was unfriendly and rude. I was absolutely unsatisfied with them! I have not received the complimentary upgrade which is associated with my Gold SPG membership card. When i asked them is there any chance to received it, they have denied it, they said we are fully booked. However, the hotel was almost empty! I think i will not choose this hotel anymore!
reviews.title: Trip in Quebec city

reviews.text: We stayed for one night on our way back down from Gaspésie before heading to Connecticut. The hotel is brand new and has a contemporary chic feel. The staff were very freindly and eager to please at all times. The room was very comfortable, with a view of old Quebec in the distance, and everything to make our stay pleasant.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While there was a free shuttle to the Lévis ferry , we chose to use our own car for more freedom of movement, and parking at the docks was actually quite reasonable priced. That way, we went back into Quebec for our evening meal after the girls had fun in the hotel's wonderfully heated (pocket) swimming pool.
reviews.title: Very big and modern rooms

reviews.text: Breakfast in the morning was served in a funky bar-restaurant area, and everything we ordered was plentiful and simply delicious. A special mention must be given to the kid's breakfast plate, which was stunning.Oh, and thank goodness for real expresso coffee at breakfast time ! If we're back we'll definitely check out the restaurant itself to see if it's as good as the breakfast would suggest.
reviews.title: 100% recomended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for a chic yet inexpensive place to stay while in the Quebec area or in transit, don't hesitate to book here.You'll no doubt have a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Great Value Way of seeing Quebec City

reviews.text: We spent one night at the Four Points Lévis on our way to Montréal from Gaspé Peninsula. The hotel is located in the suburbs of Lévis, near the highway 20. Actually the neighbourhood is not that attractive but for us it was convenient, being not far away from the highway.
reviews.title: Absolutely Awesome Hotel
